intro: Cyrtandra punctatissima, commonly known as the spotted cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a distinct veining pattern, while its flowers are borne in clusters. Cyrtandra punctatissima is also notable for its role in Hawaiian ecosystems and its potential medicinal uses.
